intro: Oldenburgia, commonly known as the Oldenburgia plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plants are characterized by their palmate leaves and showy, often brightly colored flowers that bloom in clusters. They are often used in ornamental horticulture due to their attractive foliage and floral displays. Oldenburgia species typically thrive in well-drained soils and require moderate to high levels of sunlight.
